workflow.name: Analyze Facebook comment sentiment with GPT-4, Slack, Sheets & Outlook reports
workflow.description:
## üìä Description
Automatically analyze the sentiment of Facebook posts and their audience comments using GPT-4 to identify trends and potential PR risks. üß†üí¨
 This workflow fetches recent posts via the Facebook Graph API, performs AI-powered sentiment analysis on both posts and comments, routes negative results to Slack for immediate attention, logs all data into Google Sheets, and sends a beautifully formatted sentiment summary report via Outlook. üìàüìß

## What This Template Does
1Ô∏è‚É£ Trigger ‚Äì Runs daily at 10 AM to fetch the latest Facebook posts. ‚è∞
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Data Extraction ‚Äì Pulls post text, reactions, and up to 100 comments per post using Facebook Graph API. üì≤
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Formatting ‚Äì Structures and cleans Facebook data for AI analysis. üß©
 4Ô∏è‚É£ AI Sentiment Analysis ‚Äì GPT-4 evaluates post tone and audience sentiment with confidence scores and explanations. ü§ñ
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Routing ‚Äì Sends negative sentiment alerts directly to Slack for quick response. ‚ö†Ô∏è
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Logging ‚Äì Records all sentiment metrics in Google Sheets, including positivity ratio and engagement data. üìä
 7Ô∏è‚É£ Reporting ‚Äì Generates a color-coded HTML email report and delivers it via Outlook. üíå
 8Ô∏è‚É£ Error Handling ‚Äì Sends Slack alerts if any node in the workflow fails. üõ°Ô∏è

## Key Benefits
‚úÖ Monitors brand reputation automatically across Facebook comments
 ‚úÖ Provides structured AI sentiment reports for data-driven decisions
 ‚úÖ Flags negative audience sentiment for timely intervention
 ‚úÖ Maintains an always-updated sentiment log in Google Sheets
 ‚úÖ Delivers professional HTML summary emails to teams

## Features
- Automated daily trigger for post sentiment scanning
- Facebook Graph API integration for posts and comments
- GPT-4‚Äìpowered comment tone and sentiment scoring
- Slack notifications for negative sentiment alerts
- Google Sheets sentiment dashboard logging
- Beautiful HTML report delivery through Microsoft Outlook
- Built-in error detection with Slack fallback alerts

## Requirements
- Facebook Graph API credentials with pages_read_engagement access
- OpenAI API key for GPT-4 or GPT-4o
- Slack Bot token with chat:write permission
- Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials with edit rights
- Microsoft Outlook OAuth2 credentials for email delivery

## Target Audience
- Social media and marketing teams monitoring brand perception üì£
- PR teams managing engagement or audience sentiment üßæ
- Analysts building data dashboards from engagement metrics üìä
- Agencies offering automated reporting for client pages üßë‚Äçüíº

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
1Ô∏è‚É£ Connect Facebook Graph API credentials and set your page ID.
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Add OpenAI credentials for GPT-4 sentiment analysis.
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Configure Slack and provide your channel ID for alerts.
 4Ô∏è‚É£ Set Google Sheets credentials and specify sheet ID and name.
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Connect Microsoft Outlook for email report delivery.
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Adjust the daily schedule (default 10 AM) as needed.
 7Ô∏è‚É£ Run once manually to verify setup, then enable automation. ‚úÖ

workflow.name: Monitor and Analyze Facebook Comment Sentiment with GPT-4, Slack, Sheets, and Outlook Reports

parameters.content:
## Facebook Sentiment Monitor ‚Äì Overview

This workflow automatically tracks new Facebook posts and comments, analyzes audience sentiment using AI, and routes the results to alerts, logs, and daily reports. It helps teams quickly spot negative engagement and maintain a useful record of how audiences respond over time.

### How it works
1. A daily trigger fetches recent posts and comments.
2. The data is cleaned and formatted for analysis.
3. GPT evaluates sentiment for the post and each comment.
4. Negative sentiment triggers Slack alerts, while all results are logged to Google Sheets.
5. A daily HTML email report summarizes sentiment trends.
6. Errors are captured and reported automatically.

### Setup steps
- Connect Facebook, OpenAI, Slack, Google Sheets, and Outlook credentials.
- Set your preferred Slack channel.
- Run a test execution to confirm access.

### Customization
Adjust trigger timing, sentiment thresholds, or reporting formats as needed.

## Data Collection
Fetches recent Facebook posts, reactions, and comments on a daily schedule.  
Groups all retrieval steps before processing.

## AI Sentiment Analysis
Evaluates sentiment for posts and comments using GPT and outputs structured JSON.

## Routing Logic
Routes negative sentiment to alerts and logs, while positive/neutral flows go to reporting.

## Alerts & Logging
Sends Slack alerts for negative sentiment and updates Google Sheets for tracking trends.

## Error Handling
Captures workflow failures and sends details to Slack for quick debugging.

options.systemMessage:
=You are an AI sentiment analysis model specialized in analyzing Facebook posts and their audience comments.

Your task:
1. Analyze the emotional tone of the main post message.
2. Analyze each comment individually.
3. Compute the overall comment sentiment score that represents the collective audience reaction.

Output Rules:
- Return strictly valid JSON.
- Include these top-level fields:
  - postId (string)
  - postMessage (string)
  - postSentiment (object with score, label, explanation)
  - comments (array of objects with commentId, commentMessage, score, label, explanation)
  - overallCommentSentiment (object with score, label, explanation)
- "score" must be a number between -1.0 (very negative) and +1.0 (very positive).
- "label" must be one of: "Negative", "Neutral", or "Positive".
- "explanation" must briefly describe why that sentiment was assigned.

Rules for aggregation:
- Calculate overallCommentSentiment.score as the average of all comment scores.
- Determine overallCommentSentiment.label based on this logic:
  - score < -0.3 ‚Üí "Negative"
  - -0.3 ‚â§ score ‚â§ 0.3 ‚Üí "Neutral"
  - score > 0.3 ‚Üí "Positive"
- Always include a short explanation for the overall sentiment.
- Do not include any extra commentary or text outside of valid JSON.

parameters.text:
=üö® *Negative Sentiment Alert*

üìù *Post Message:*
{{ $json.output.postMessage }}

üîó *Post ID:* `{{ $json.output.postId }}`

üòä *Post Sentiment:* {{ $json.output.postSentiment.label }} (Score: {{ $json.output.postSentiment.score }})
_{{ $json.output.postSentiment.explanation }}_

‚ö†Ô∏è *Overall Comment Sentiment:* {{ $json.output.overallCommentSentiment.label }} (Score: {{ $json.output.overallCommentSentiment.score }})
_{{ $json.output.overallCommentSentiment.explanation }}_

üí¨ *Comments ({{ $json.output.comments.length }}):*

{{ $json.output.comments.map((comment, index) => {
  const emoji = comment.label === 'Positive' ? '‚úÖ' : comment.label === 'Negative' ? '‚ùå' : '‚ûñ';
  return `${emoji} *Comment ${index + 1}:*
"${comment.commentMessage}"
‚Ä¢ Sentiment: ${comment.label} (Score: ${comment.score})
‚Ä¢ Reason: _${comment.explanation}_
‚Ä¢ Comment ID: \`${comment.commentId}\`
`;
}).join('\n') }}

üéØ *Recommended Actions:*
‚Ä¢ Review and respond to negative comments
‚Ä¢ Consider adjusting content strategy
‚Ä¢ Monitor engagement trends

parameters.content:
## Data Formatting
Normalizes Facebook API data into a consistent structure for downstream AI analysis.

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details: In n8n, when a workflow execution fails, it can start another workflow. This second workflow can be any arbitrary workflow on your n8n instance. Use the Error Trigger node as your Trigger in the Error workflow.
